Charlotte Ballet cancels opening 2 shows of Most Incredible Thing ; rest of run will go on

Order Reprint of this Story March 09 2018 04 45 PM Charlotte Ballet on Friday afternoon cancelled the opening scheduled for later that evening of “The Most Incredible Thing.” Saturday’s matinee was also cancelled but plans called for the rest of the performances to go as scheduled Saturday evening through March 18. A performance was added as well on March 14. Ticket holders may exchange for any other performance in the run here . An email from the Ballet said that mechanical failure caused the delay. The Charlotte run is the American premiere of the fairytale/pop-music ballet set to music by the Pet Shop Boys and based on a Hans Christian Andersen tale – and choreographed by Javier de Frutos who’s also currently an artist-in-residence at the McColl Center.
